title: Chicago Acupuncturists
description: Looking for acupuncture in Chicago? Our Chicago acupuncturists offer a range of specialties, including pain management, fertility, and stress relief.
cleaned_text: Chicago Acupuncturists Individualized patient-centered Acupuncture & Traditional Chinese Medicine serving the Andersonville and surrounding Chicago neighborhoods since 2002. Ravenswood Chiropractic in Chicago has been providing high-quality acupuncture services since 2002. Our experienced acupuncturists offer effective, safe, and natural solutions for many [conditions](https://www.rennwellness.com/common-conditions.html). We offer a full range of treatments, including [acupuncture](https://www.rennwellness.com/acupuncture.html), [cupping therapy](https://www.rennwellness.com/acupuncture/cupping-and-acupuncture-chicago.html), [moxibustion](https://www.rennwellness.com/acupuncture/moxibustion-therapy-chicago.html), and [traditional Chinese medicine](https://www.rennwellness.com/acupuncture/traditional-chinese-medicine-and-acupuncture.html). Our friendly acupuncturists will help you find the best treatment option for you. Our clinic is located in the heart of Chicago's vibrant Andersonville neighborhood, steps away from Clark Street. The clinic offers convenient hours, including evenings and weekends, and extended hours during major holidays. Get quality care from expert acupuncturists for all your Traditional Chinese Medicine needs right here in your neighborhood. If you live in the Chicago area, you can schedule an appointment today with Marlena Siroki and our team at Ravenswood Chiropractic & Wellness Center. We offer convenient appointments throughout the week and [we accept health insurance plans](https://www.rennwellness.com/pre-verify-your-insurance.html). Our acupuncture team is expert in providing Traditional Chinese Medicine services that include acupuncture, Acupressure, Cupping, Gua Sha, Auricular Acupuncture (Ear), Moxa, and Eastern Nutrition. Schedule Your Acupuncture Appointment Today Ravenswood Chiropractic in Chicago is proud to deliver a forward-thinking vision of a collaborative healthcare team providing patient-centered care with quality results since 2002. Our [Traditional Chinese Medicine ](https://www.rennwellness.com/acupuncture/traditional-chinese-medicine-and-acupuncture.html)treatments have been successfully used alongside 20 years. Our [acupuncturists](https://www.rennwellness.com/about-us/our-team.html) are here to help you heal and feel your best. Our acupuncturists work both independently with patients or in collaboration with the rest of the team of providers at our office or elsewhere to provide you a comprehensive treatment plan with your needs and goals at the center of all we do. What is Acupuncture Acupuncture is an eastern medicine used to treat [pain](https://www.rennwellness.com/acupuncture/acupuncture-for-pain.html), [stress](https://www.rennwellness.com/acupuncture/acupuncture-for-stress.html), [anxiety](https://www.rennwellness.com/acupuncture-for-depression-and-anxiety.html), [depression](https://www.rennwellness.com/acupuncture-for-depression-and-anxiety.html), [insomnia](https://www.rennwellness.com/acupuncture-for-insomnia.html), and many other conditions. The theory behind acupuncture is based on the belief that there are channels of energy throughout the human body that connect all body parts. These channels are known as [meridians](https://www.rennwellness.com/blog/what-is-qi.html). When the energy flows along these meridians, it helps maintain good health. Acupuncture is an ancient Chinese practice that involves inserting fine, sterile, single-use needles into specific points on the body to stimulate energy flow through those areas. Find Out Why We Stand Out From The Rest: "He's outlined a course of treatment and the front desk staff was easy going and helpful in explaining insurance and payment options." (Yelp) Beth G. How Often Should I Get Acupuncture Treatments? The answer depends on how much qi energy is being blocked. After your [first acupuncture evaluation](https://www.rennwellness.com/what-to-expect-during-your-first-visit.html), our acupuncturist will let you know her recommendation, and you will learn how your body responds after your first treatment. In general, acupuncture takes about 30-60 minutes per treatment. However, some people may feel immediate relief, and their symptoms are resolved after just a few treatments. The theory behind acupuncture is that these meridians are believed to carry life force energy called qi, and illness or symptoms may occur when blocked. The flow of energy is restored by unblocking the flow of energy at specific points along the meridian's, and our patients feels better. We Provide Same Day Acupuncture Appointments You can schedule and reschedule your appointments conveniently online through our [patient scheduling portal](https://www.rennwellness.com/easy-online-scheduling-247.html). If you are in pain and need a same-day appointment or don't see a time that fits your schedule, please call/text our office at 773.878.7330. We are here for you to help get you out of pain. We also see same-day appointments for many other urgent conditions such as [fertility patients](https://www.rennwellness.com/acupuncture/acupuncture-for-fertility.html), [mom's in labor](https://www.rennwellness.com/acupuncture/acupuncture-for-labor-induction.html) or with [morning sickness](https://www.rennwellness.com/morning-sickness.html), needs](https://www.rennwellness.com/acupuncture/emotional-health-acupuncture.html), as well as our [ asthma patients](https://www.rennwellness.com/acupuncture-for-asthma.html) and anyone else who has an urgent issue. How Can You Benefit From an Acupuncture Treatment There are many reasons people choose to receive acupuncture treatment. Many find it helpful for relieving pain, improving sleep quality, and reducing stress levels. Others use it as part of a holistic approach to wellness, incorporating it into their diet and lifestyle choices. Regardless of the reason you choose acupuncture, the aim of acupuncture is to restore balance in your body holistically. Patients are often surprised at improved mood symptoms after acupuncture treatment. They may feel calm, happy or report enhanced mental clarity. Some Western research studies have found that acupuncture can lower stress hormone levels which explains this potential benefit of feeling improved mood. 5215 N. If your health insurance plan covers acupuncture services outside of our network, we can assist you in submitting claims for reimbursement. If unsure, you can submit your insurance information to [get pre-verified before your first visit at no obligation or cost to you.](https://www.rennwellness.com/pre-verify-your-insurance.html) Additional Payment Options include Flex Spending and Health Savings Accounts as well as our [ChiroHealth Discount Program](https://www.rennwellness.com/chirohealth-usa-discount-membership-program.html) and [CareCredit](https://www.rennwellness.com/carecredit.html), these are accepted for acupuncture services and you can apply for at the time of your visit or by clicking the links above which will take you directly to the page with more information and how to apply. Our Chicago Acupuncture team offers a variety of [treatments for pain relief](https://www.rennwellness.com/chiropractor-for-pain-in-chicago.html), stress management, weight loss, and many other conditions. Our highly trained acupuncturists will provide you with the best care possible. Acupuncture Helps Your Body Heal Itself Our Acupuncturists are part of our team of providers at Ravenswood Chiropractic & Wellness Center, an evidence-based practice in Chicago, Illinois. Western science's working theory is that acupuncture treatments stimulate your central nervous system, which signals the release of biochemicals that promote both physical and emotional health (lower stress hormones). This unburdens your body (from pain and stress), giving it more optimal conditions for its innate healing to occur. Our clinic offers [acupuncture treatments for pain relief](https://www.rennwellness.com/acupuncture/acupuncture-for-pain.html), [stress management](https://www.rennwellness.com/acupuncture/acupuncture-for-stress.html), [weight loss](https://www.rennwellness.com/andersonville-acupuncture-for-weight-loss.html), [sports injuries](https://www.rennwellness.com/blog/top-10-reasons-every-athlete-needs-an-acupuncturist-on-their-team.html), and many other conditions. We are located in the heart of the Andersonville neighborhood in Chicago. We offer [traditional Acupuncture Work? Acupuncture is based on the theory that there are channels through which energy flows throughout the body. These channels are known as meridians. According to traditional Chinese medicine, these channels are connected to organs and glands, and when they become blocked, illness results. In addition to acupuncture, Traditional Chinese Medicine includes herbal remedies, dietary changes, massage, meditation, and qi gong exercises that work together to unblock meridians so qi can move freely throughout your body and promote physical and emotional healing for your whole body. Learn More About Additional Services We Provide: Chiropractic Care Massage Therapy Physical Therapy Acupuncture Functional Medicine Meet Our Acupuncturist Dr. Marlena Siroki, DACM, LAc - Nationally Board-certified Acupuncturist and Herbalist - Chinese and Master Tung Style Acupuncture - Diplomate in Acupuncture and Chinese Medicine - Offers a Free Consultation to discuss if acupuncture is right for you. [Read More about Dr. Marlena Siroki](https://www.rennwellness.com/marlena-siroki.html) We Follow COVID-19 Mitigation Strategies and Offer TeleHealth Learn more about our [COVID-19 precautions](https://www.rennwellness.com/covid-19-resource-center.html) and how we keep you and our team healthy. If you are unable to come to our office for care, [TeleHealth ](https://www.rennwellness.com/telehealth.html)is available. Our acupuncture team can help you with self-care at home including [acupressure](https://www.rennwellness.com/acupuncture/acupressure.html), [herbal consultations](https://www.rennwellness.com/acupuncture/chinese-herbal-medicine.html), and other recommendations needed. What Does Acupuncture Feel Like? Does It Hurt? The word acupuncture comes from two Chinese characters meaning needle and channel. It refers to the insertion of fine, sterilized, single-use metal needles into specific points (acu-points) on the body. These points correspond to energy pathways known as meridians. The needles are about the thickness of a hair, which is much smaller than needles used for blood draws. Many patients report that they do not feel the needles when inserted, just the flow of energy, like a warmness, once the needles are in place. There are lots of [alternatives to needles](https://www.rennwellness.com/acupuncture/afraid-of-needles.html) allowing you to get the same great benefits of acupuncture without the needles. We also offer [acupressure](https://www.rennwellness.com/acupuncture/acupressure.html) and other traditional Chinese medicine modalities like [cupping](https://www.rennwellness.com/acupuncture/cupping-and-acupuncture-chicago.html), [herbs](https://www.rennwellness.com/acupuncture/chinese-herbal-medicine.html), and [gua sha](https://www.rennwellness.com/acupuncture/gua-sha-technique-chicago.html), that can provide the same
